summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena includes an attached rider detailing the recipient's rights and the scope of the requested materials.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena commands the production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed recipient of the subpoena is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and give evidence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, in the Southern District of New York.
The subpoena commands the production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes.

The subpoena has a broad scope, covering responsive documents on computers, email accounts, iCloud accounts, servers, cellphones, and other personal electronic devices, whether in the U.S. or any foreign jurisdiction.

The subpoena references alleged violations of federal statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records in federal investigations).
The recipient of the subpoena is not named in the provided text.
